description: A bus driver in Peru could face up to two years in prison after being caught launching a vicious attack on a disabled man in CCTV footage taken in the Lurigancho-Chosica district of Lima.
title: Disabled man in Peru viciously beaten by bus driver in video
title_page: Disabled man in Peru viciously beaten by bus driver in video | Daily Mail Online
text:
A bus driver in Peru is facing jail after CCTV cameras captured him viciously attacking a helpless disabled man in the street.
According to witnesses, the young handicapped man was waiting to get on the bus, in the Lurigancho-Chosica district of the Lima Province in Peru, but the driver hit him as he pulls up to the stop.
Instead of stopping to help, the driver carries on driving forward to pick up other passengers further down the line, and when the disabled man protested he launched the assault.
A bus driver could face up to two years in prison after a vicious assault on a disabled man, pictured
The disabled man appears to be hit by the bus in CCTV footage, and then lashes out against it with his crutch
The driver then stuns passengers by getting out of the vehicle and kicking and stamping on the prone man
After being hit by the vehicle, the disabled man used one of his crutches to bang against the windows of the bus in frustration.
But in a shocking twist, the driver then stops the bus, walks over to the man and kicks him hard.
The disabled man was left crumpled on the ground, after which the driver started stomping on his head before other passengers and passers-by intervened.
The attack lasts for around half a minute as the disabled man struggles to protect himself
Eventually passengers and passers-by intervene to stop the attack continuing and the man was arrested
The next moments on the tape show the aggressor in a heated conversation with the bystanders while the injured man remains curled up on the floor holding his head.
Soon policemen and paramedics arrive on the scene, to attend to the victim and arrest his attacker.
A police spokesman said: 'It seems a clear-cut case of an unprovoked assault.'
